intro: Eranthemum angustifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leaved eranthemum, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant, showy blooms that range in color from pink to red. Eranthemum angustifolium is also valued for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
